main event: A witness observed a large bright disc hovering in the sky in Baker, Montana on March 13, 1966.
interesting points: The object appeared larger than an aircraft., It hovered for approximately 1.5 minutes before disappearing to the southeast., The brightness of the object was compared to a welding light and was described as being much brighter than a star., The observation lasted for about 30 minutes., The Air Force later evaluated the sighting and concluded it was likely the planet Venus.
